contextId.information: Both of these questions are asked to point out the fact that people die. AT: "Your fathers have died. The prophets will also die." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: Your fathers, where are they? Where are the prophets, are they here forever?

contextId.information: AT: "Joshua is like a stick pulled from a fire" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: Is this not a brand pulled from the fire?

contextId.information: This question is not asked to receive an answer but to tell the people not to despise "the day of small things". (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
"You should know what these are, but you do not." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: Do you not know what these are?

contextId.information: This question is used to accuse the people of Israel who celebrated the feasts for not honoring God with their feasting. AT: "it was for yourselves that you ate and drank" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: did you not eat and drink for yourselves?

contextId.information: This question can be written as a statement. "These were exactly the same words ... to the west." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: Were these not the same words ... to the west?

contextId.information: God is asking this question in order to persuade his people to trust in his promises. AT: "it will surely be possible for me!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: should it also seem impossible in my eyes?
